page.title: 05THE THELWALL 'EYES'
page.content:
One of the main features of this area are the 400 acres of marshy land known as the Thelwall 'Eyes'.
These are the result of years of dredging of the adjacent{Manchester {Ship Canal.}The whole of the area is encircled with a 15 metre embankment of earth. The mud is piped into the enclosure and left to settle. When one section is full it is allowed to dry out and another already-dry one is used.
The land is of no economic value but is a haven for wildlife attracting many species of bird especially duck and waders.
Wardens patrol the site and there is a hide for keen ornithologists.
